009package imagingbook.common.geometry.basic;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.isZero;
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import java.awt.Point;
015import java.awt.Shape;
016import java.awt.geom.Ellipse2D;
017import java.awt.geom.Point2D;
018import java.util.Locale;
019
020import org.apache.commons.math3.geometry.euclidean.twod.Vector2D;
021import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
022import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
023
024import imagingbook.common.geometry.shape.ShapeProducer;
025import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
026
027/**
028 * Interface specifying the behavior of simple 2D points. It is used to adapt to different (legacy) point
029 * implementations with a common API. To some extent this is similar to the functionality provided by {@link Point2D}
030 * and {@link Point} but was re-implemented to avoid dependency on AWT and for more flexibility in naming and class
031 * structure. Since defined as an interface, {@link Pnt2d} can be easily implemented by other point-like structures,
032 * e.g. corners (see {@link imagingbook.common.corners.Corner}). <br> Two concrete (nested) classes are defined for
033 * points with {@code double} and {@code int} coordinates, respectively. See {@link Pnt2d.PntDouble} and
034 * {@link Pnt2d.PntInt} for how to instantiate such point objects.
035 *
036 * @author WB
037 */
038public interface Pnt2d extends ShapeProducer, Primitive2d {
039
040        /**
041         * The default tolerance for matching coordinates (1E-6).
042         */
043        public final static double TOLERANCE = 1E-6;
044
045        /**
046         * Returns the x-coordinate of this point.
047         * @return the x-coordinate value
048         */
049        double getX();
050
051        /**
052         * Returns the y-coordinate of this point.
053         * @return the y-coordinate value
054         */
055        double getY();
056
057        /**
058         * Returns the x-coordinate of this point as a (truncated) integer value.
059         *
060         * @return the integer x-coordinate of this point.
061         */
062        public default int getXint() {
063                return (int) this.getX();
064        }
065
066        /**
067         * Returns the y-coordinate of this point as a (truncated) integer value.
068         *
069         * @return the integer y-coordinate of this point.
070         */
071        public default int getYint() {
072                return (int) this.getY();
073        }
074
075        // ----------------------------------------------------------
076
077        /**
078         * Creates and returns a new point of type {@link Pnt2d.PntInt} with the specified coordinates. See also
079         * {@link PntInt#from(int, int)}.
080         *
081         * @param x coordinate
082         * @param y coordinate
083         * @return the new point
084         */
085        public static Pnt2d from(int x, int y) {
086                return PntInt.from(x, y);
087        }
088
089        /**
090         * Creates and returns a new point of type {@link Pnt2d.PntInt} with the specified coordinates. See also
091         * {@link PntInt#from(int[])}.
092         *
093         * @param xy coordinates
094         * @return the new point
095         */
096        public static Pnt2d from(int[] xy) {
097                return PntInt.from(xy);
098        }
099
100        /**
101         * Creates and returns a new point of type {@link Pnt2d.PntDouble} with the specified coordinates. See also
102         * {@link PntDouble#from(double, double)}.
103         *
104         * @param x coordinate
105         * @param y coordinate
106         * @return the new point
107         */
108        public static Pnt2d from(double x, double y) {
109                return PntDouble.from(x, y);
110        }
111
112        /**
113         * Creates and returns a new point of type {@link Pnt2d.PntDouble} with the specified coordinates. See also
114         * {@link PntDouble#from(double[])}.
115         *
116         * @param xy coordinates
117         * @return the new point
118         */
119        public static Pnt2d from(double[] xy) {
120                return PntDouble.from(xy[0], xy[1]);
121        }
122        
123        public static Pnt2d from(Pnt2d p) {
124                if (p instanceof PntInt) {
125                        return PntInt.from(p);
126                }
127                else  {
128                        return PntDouble.from(p);
129                }
130        }
131
132        public static Pnt2d from(Point2D p) {
133                if (p instanceof Point) {
134                        Point pi = (Point) p;
135                        return PntInt.from(pi.x, pi.y);
136                }
137                else {
138                        return PntDouble.from(p.getX(), p.getY());
139                }
140        }
141
142        // ----------------------------------------------------------
143
144        /**
145         * Returns this point's coordinates as a new 2-element {@code double} array.
146         * @return the array
147         */
148        public default double[] toDoubleArray() {
149                return new double[] {this.getX(), this.getY()};
150        }
151
152        /**
153         * Returns this point's coordinates as a new AWT {@link java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double} point.
154         * @return the new point
155         */
156        public default Point2D.Double toAwtPoint2D() {
157                return new Point2D.Double(this.getX(), this.getY());
158        }
159
160        /**
161         * Returns this point's coordinates as a new {@link Vector2D} instance (for interfacing with Apache Commons Math).
162         *
163         * @return a new vector
164         */
165        public default Vector2D toVector2D() {
166                return new Vector2D(getX(), getY());
167        }
168
169        /**
170         * Returns this point's coordinates as a new {@link RealVector} instance (for interfacing with Apache Commons
171         * Math).
172         *
173         * @return a new vector
174         */
175        public default RealVector toRealVector() {
176                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(this.toDoubleArray());
177        }
178
179        /**
180         * Returns a copy of this point which is of the same type as the original.
181         * @return a new instance.
182         */
183        public default Pnt2d duplicate() {
184                throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
185        }
186
187        /**
188         * Returns a new point whose coordinates are the sum of this point and the given point. The concrete type of the
189         * returned object depends on the type of the original points.
190         *
191         * @param p the point to be added
192         * @return a new point
193         */
194        public default Pnt2d plus(Pnt2d p) {
195                return this.plus(p.getX(), p.getY());
196        }
197
198        /**
199         * Returns a new point whose coordinates are the sum of this point and the specified {@code double} coordinates.
200         *
201         * @param dx the x-coordinate to be added
202         * @param dy the y-coordinate to be added
203         * @return a new point
204         */
205        public default Pnt2d plus(double dx, double dy) {
206                return new PntDouble(this.getX() + dx, this.getY() + dy);
207        }
208
209        /**
210         * Returns a new point whose coordinates are the difference of this point and the given point.
211         *
212         * @param p the point to be subtracted
213         * @return a new point
214         */
215        public default Pnt2d minus(Pnt2d p) {
216                return this.minus(p.getX(), p.getY());
217        }
218
219        /**
220         * Returns a new point whose coordinates are multiplied by the specified scalar value.
221         *
222         * @param s some scalar value
223         * @return a new point
224         */
225        public default Pnt2d mult(double s) {
226                return new PntDouble(s * this.getX(), s * this.getY());
227        }
228
229        /**
230         * Returns a new point whose coordinates are the difference of this point and the given point (specified as a
231         * coordinate pair).
232         *
233         * @param dx x-coordinate
234         * @param dy y-coordinate
235         * @return a new point
236         */
237        public default Pnt2d minus(double dx, double dy) {
238                return new PntDouble(this.getX() - dx, this.getY() - dy);
239        }
240
241        /**
242         * Returns a point (vector) perpendicular to this point (vector).
243         * @return a perpendicular vector
244         */
245        public default Pnt2d perp() {
246                return new PntDouble(this.getY(), -this.getX());
247        }
248
249        /**
250         * Calculates and returns the dot product of this point and another point (both points are interpreted as 2D
251         * vectors)
252         *
253         * @param other the point (vector) to be multiplied by this vector
254         * @return a new point (vector)
255         */
256        public default double dot(Pnt2d other) {
257                return this.getX() * other.getX() + this.getY() * other.getY();
258        }
259
260        /**
261         * Calculates and returns the 2D pseudo cross product of this point and another point (both points are interpreted
262         * as 2D vectors). The result of {@code a.cross(b)} is equivalent to {@code a.perp().dot(b)}.
263         *
264         * @param other the point (vector) to be multiplied to the perpendicular vector of this vector
265         * @return a new point (vector)
266         */
267        public default double cross(Pnt2d other) {
268                return this.getY() * other.getX() - this.getX() * other.getY();
269        }
270
271
272        // ----------------------------------------------------------
273
274        /**
275         * Tests if this point matches the given point, i.e., if both coordinate differences are zero (&lt; than the
276         * specified tolerance).
277         *
278         * @param p the point to be matched to
279         * @param tolerance the tolerance (see also {@link #TOLERANCE}).
280         * @return true if both points match
281         */
282        public default boolean equals(Pnt2d p, double tolerance) {
283                return isZero(this.getX() - p.getX(), tolerance) 
284                                && isZero(this.getY() - p.getY(), tolerance);
285        }
286
287        // ----------------------------------------------------------
288
289        /**
290         * Returns the squared L2 distance between this point and the given point.
291         *
292         * @param other the other point
293         * @return the squared distance
294         */
295        public default double distanceSq(Pnt2d other) {
296                return sqr(this.getX() - other.getX()) + sqr(this.getY() - other.getY());
297        }
298
299        /**
300         * Returns the L2 (Euclidean) distance between this point and the given point. This method is equivalent to
301         * {@link #distL2(Pnt2d)}.
302         *
303         * @param other the other point
304         * @return the distance
305         */
306        public default double distance(Pnt2d other) {
307                return Math.sqrt(this.distanceSq(other));
308        }
309
310
311        /**
312         * Implementation required by {@link Primitive2d} interface.
313         */
314        @Override
315        public default double getDistance(Pnt2d other) {
316                return Math.sqrt(this.distanceSq(other));
317        }
318
319        /**
320         * Returns the L2 (Euclidean) distance between this point and the given point. This method is equivalent to
321         * {@link #distance(Pnt2d)}.
322         *
323         * @param other the other point
324         * @return the distance
325         */
326        public default double distL2(Pnt2d other) {
327                return distance(other);
328        }
329
330        /**
331         * Returns the L1 (Manhattan) distance between this point and the given point.
332         *
333         * @param other the other point
334         * @return the distance
335         */
336        public default double distL1(Pnt2d other) {
337                return Math.abs(this.getX() - other.getX()) + Math.abs(this.getY() - other.getY());
338        }
339
340        public static final double DefaultDotRadius = 1.0;
341
342        /**
343         * Returns a round dot ({@link Shape} instance) for drawing this point.
344         * 
345         * @param scale the dot radius
346         * @return the shape
347         */
348        @Override
349        public default Shape getShape(double scale) {
350                double rad = scale * DefaultDotRadius;
351//              return new Arc2D.Double(getX() - rad, getY() - rad, 2 * rad, 2 * rad, 0, 360, Arc2D.CHORD);
352                return new Ellipse2D.Double(getX() - rad, getY() - rad, 2 * rad, 2 * rad);
353        }
354
355        // ----------------------------------------------------------
356
357        /**
358         * Immutable 2D point implementation with {@code double} coordinates. This class implements the {@link Pnt2d}
359         * interface. A protected constructor is provided but the preferred way of instantiation is by one of the static
360         * factory methods, such as {@link #from(double, double)}, {@link #from(double[])}, etc. Access to the coordinate
361         * values is provided by the methods {@link #getX()} and {@link #getY()}, but the actual field variables {@link #x},
362         * {@link #y} are also publicly accessible (for better performance and less clutter).
363         */
364        public class PntDouble implements Pnt2d {
365
366                /**
367                 * Singleton point instance with zero coordinates.
368                 */
369                public static final PntDouble ZERO = PntDouble.from(0.0, 0.0);
370
371                /** The (immutable) x-coordinate of this point */
372                public final double x;
373                /** The (immutable) y-coordinate of this point */
374                public final double y;
375
376                /**
377                 * Constructor.
378                 * @param x x-coordinate
379                 * @param y y-coordinate
380                 */
381                protected PntDouble(double x, double y) {
382                        this.x = x;
383                        this.y = y;
384                }
385
386                @Override
387                public PntDouble duplicate() {
388                        return new PntDouble(this.x, this.y);
389                }
390
391                // static factory methods ---------------------------------
392
393                /**
394                 * Returns a new {@link PntDouble} instance.
395                 * @param xy x/y-coordinate array
396                 * @return the new point
397                 */
398                public static PntDouble from(double[] xy) {
399                        return new PntDouble(xy[0], xy[1]);
400                }
401
402                /**
403                 * Returns a new {@link PntDouble} instance.
404                 * @param x x-coordinate value
405                 * @param y y-coordinate value
406                 * @return the new point
407                 */
408                public static PntDouble from(double x, double y) {
409                        return new PntDouble(x, y);
410                }
411
412                /**
413                 * Returns a new {@link PntDouble} instance with the same coordinates as the given point. Equivalent to
414                 * {@link #duplicate()}.
415                 *
416                 * @param p the original point
417                 * @return the new point
418                 */
419                public static PntDouble from(Pnt2d p) {
420                        return new PntDouble(p.getX(), p.getY());
421                }
422
423                /**
424                 * Returns a new {@link PntDouble} instance with the same coordinates as the given AWT {@link Point2D}.
425                 *
426                 * @param p the original AWT point
427                 * @return the new point
428                 */
429                public static PntDouble from(Point2D p) {
430                        return new PntDouble(p.getX(), p.getY());
431                }
432
433                /**
434                 * Returns a new {@link PntDouble} instance with the same coordinates as the given Apache Commons Math
435                 * {@link Vector2D}.
436                 *
437                 * @param vec the original coordinate vector
438                 * @return the new point
439                 */
440                public static PntDouble from(Vector2D vec) {
441                        return new PntDouble(vec.getX(), vec.getY());
442                }       
443
444                // getter methods
445
446                @Override
447                public double getX() {
448                        return this.x;
449                }
450
451                @Override
452                public double getY() {
453                        return this.y;
454                }
455
456                @Override
457                public int getXint() {
458                        return (int) this.x;
459                }
460
461                @Override
462                public int getYint() {
463                        return (int) this.y;
464                }
465
466
467                // addition -----------------------------------
468
469                @Override
470                public PntDouble plus(double dx, double dy) {
471                        return new PntDouble(this.x + dx, this.y + dy);
472                }
473
474                // subtraction -----------------------------------
475
476                @Override
477                public PntDouble minus(Pnt2d p) {
478                        return new PntDouble(this.x - p.getX(), this.y - p.getY());
479                }
480
481                // equality -----------------------------------
482
483                @Override
484                public boolean equals(Object p) {
485                        if (this == p) {
486                                return true;
487                        }
488                        if (p instanceof Pnt2d) {
489                                return this.equals((Pnt2d) p, TOLERANCE);
490                        }
491                        return false;
492                }
493
494                // misc -----------------------------------
495
496                /**
497                 * {@inheritDoc} The number of output digits is specified by the current settings of {@link PrintPrecision}. Use
498                 * {@link PrintPrecision#set(int)} or {@link PrintPrecision#reset()} to change.
499                 */
500                @Override       
501                public String toString() {
502                        String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
503                        return String.format(Locale.US, "%s[" + fStr + ", " + fStr + "]",
504                                        getClass().getSimpleName(), x, y);
505                }
506
507                @Override
508                public int hashCode() { // taken from awt.Point2D.Double
509                        long bits = java.lang.Double.doubleToLongBits(this.x);
510                        bits ^= java.lang.Double.doubleToLongBits(this.y) * 31;
511                        return (((int) bits) ^ ((int) (bits >> 32)));
512                }
513
514        }
515
516        // ----------------------------------------------------------
517
518        /**
519         * Immutable 2D point implementation with {@code int} coordinates. This class implements the {@link Pnt2d}
520         * interface. A protected constructor is provided but the preferred way of instantiation is by one of the static
521         * factory methods, such as {@link #from(int, int)}, {@link #from(int[])}, etc. The {@code int} coordinates can only
522         * be retrieved via the publicly accessible field variables {@link #x}, {@link #y}, while the methods
523         * {@link #getX()} and {@link #getY()} return {@code double} values for compatibility reasons.
524         */
525        public class PntInt implements Pnt2d {
526
527                /**
528                 * Singleton point instance with zero coordinates.
529                 */
530                public static final PntInt ZERO = PntInt.from(0, 0);
531
532                /** The (immutable) x-coordinate of this point */
533                public final int x;
534                /** The (immutable) y-coordinate of this point */
535                public final int y;
536
537
538                /**
539                 * Constructor.
540                 * @param x x-coordinate
541                 * @param y y-coordinate
542                 */
543                protected PntInt(int x, int y) {
544                        this.x = x;
545                        this.y = y;
546                }
547
548                @Override
549                public PntInt duplicate() {
550                        return new PntInt(this.x, this.y);
551                }
552
553                // static factory methods --------------------------------------
554
555                /**
556                 * Returns a new {@link PntInt} instance from a given point.
557                 *
558                 * @param p the original point
559                 * @return the new point
560                 */
561                public static PntInt from(PntInt p) {
562                        return new PntInt(p.x, p.y);
563                }
564
565                /**
566                 * Returns a new {@link PntInt} instance.
567                 * @param x x-coordinate value
568                 * @param y y-coordinate value
569                 * @return the new point
570                 */
571                public static PntInt from(int x, int y) {
572                        return new PntInt(x, y);
573                }
574
575                /**
576                 * Returns a new {@link PntInt} instance.
577                 * @param xy x/y-coordinates
578                 * @return the new point
579                 */
580                public static PntInt from(int[] xy) {
581                        return new PntInt(xy[0], xy[1]);
582                }
583
584                /**
585                 * Returns a new {@link PntInt} from a given {@link Pnt2d} instance. This only works if the argument is of type
586                 * {@link Pnt2d.PntInt}, otherwise an exception is thrown.
587                 *
588                 * @param p a point of type {@link Pnt2d.PntInt}
589                 * @return the new point
590                 */
591                public static PntInt from(Pnt2d p) {
592                        if (p instanceof PntInt) {
593                                return ((PntInt) p).duplicate();
594                        }
595                        else {
596                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot convert to " +
597                                                PntInt.class.getSimpleName());
598                        }
599                }
600
601                /**
602                 * Returns a new {@link PntDouble} instance with the same coordinates as the given AWT {@link Point}.
603                 *
604                 * @param p the original AWT point
605                 * @return the new point
606                 */
607                public static PntInt from(Point p) {
608                        return new PntInt(p.x, p.y);
609                }
610
611                // getter methods
612
613                @Override
614                public double getX() {
615                        return this.x;
616                }
617
618                @Override
619                public double getY() {
620                        return this.y;
621                }
622
623                @Override
624                public int getXint() {
625                        return this.x;
626                }
627
628                @Override
629                public int getYint() {
630                        return this.y;
631                }
632
633                // addition -----------------------------------
634                
635                public PntInt plus(int dx, int dy) {
636                        return new PntInt(this.x + dx, this.y + dy);
637                }
638
639                public PntInt plus(PntInt p) {
640                        return this.plus(p.x, p.y);
641                }
642                
643                public PntInt plus(int[] dxy) {
644                        return this.plus(dxy[0], dxy[1]);
645                }
646
647                @Override
648                public Pnt2d plus(Pnt2d p) {
649                        if (p instanceof PntInt) {               
650                                return this.plus((PntInt)p); // new PntInt(this.x + ((PntInt)p).x, this.y + ((PntInt)p).y);
651                        }
652                        else {
653                                return this.plus(p.getX(), p.getY());
654                        }
655                }
656
657                // subtraction -----------------------------------
658
659                public PntInt minus(PntInt p) {
660                        return this.minus(p.x, p.y);
661                }
662
663                public PntInt minus(int dx, int dy) {
664                        return new PntInt(this.x - dx, this.y - dy);
665                }
666
667                @Override
668                public Pnt2d minus(Pnt2d p) {
669                        if (p instanceof PntInt) {               
670                                return this.minus((PntInt)p);
671                        }
672                        else {
673                                return this.minus(p.getX(), p.getY());
674                        }
675                }
676
677                // distance -----------------------------------
678
679                /**
680                 * Returns the L1 (Manhattan) distance between this point and the given point.
681                 *
682                 * @param p the other point
683                 * @return the distance
684                 */
685                public int distL1(PntInt p) {
686                        return Math.abs(this.x - p.x) + Math.abs(this.y - p.y);
687                }
688
689                /**
690                 * Returns the squared L2 distance between this point and the given point.
691                 *
692                 * @param other the other point
693                 * @return the squared distance
694                 */
695                public int distanceSq(PntInt other) {
696                        return sqr(this.x - other.x) + sqr(this.y - other.y);
697                }
698
699                // equality -----------------------------------
700
701                @Override
702                public boolean equals(Object p) {
703                        if (this == p) {
704                                return true;
705                        }
706                        if (p instanceof PntInt) {
707                                PntInt pp = (PntInt) p;
708                                return (this.x == pp.x) && (this.y == pp.y);
709                        }
710                        if (p instanceof Pnt2d) {
711                                return this.equals((Pnt2d) p, TOLERANCE);
712                        }
713                        return false;
714                }
715
716                // misc -----------------------------------
717
718                @Override
719                public String toString() {
720                        return String.format(Locale.US, "%s[%d, %d]",
721                                        getClass().getSimpleName(), x, y);
722                }
723
724                //              @Override
725                //              public int hashCode() {
726                //                      return (17 + this.x) * 37 + this.y;     
727                //              }
728
729                @Override
730                public int hashCode() {
731                        long bits = java.lang.Double.doubleToLongBits(getX());
732                        bits ^= java.lang.Double.doubleToLongBits(getY()) * 31;
733                        return (((int) bits) ^ ((int) (bits >> 32)));
734                }
735
736                /**
737                 * Returns this point's coordinates as a new 2-element {@code int} array.
738                 * @return the array
739                 */
740                public int[] toIntArray() {
741                        return new int[] {this.x, this.y};
742                }
743
744                /**
745                 * Returns this point's coordinates as a new AWT {@link Point} point.
746                 * @return the new point
747                 */
748                public Point toAwtPoint() {
749                        return new Point(this.x, this.y);
750                }
751
752
753
754        }
755
756}
